body: Nevermind, I remember the reason why I wrote it like this. The `runtime_error` here is cleaner because it takes a printf-style string, and the code below throws `std::runtime_error` because the string stream creates a string of some sort (which is not the `char*` `runtime_error` expects as its first argument.

body_text: Nevermind, I remember the reason why I wrote it like this. The runtime_error here is cleaner because it takes a printf-style string, and the code below throws std::runtime_error because the string stream creates a string of some sort (which is not the char* runtime_error expects as its first argument.
